0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Note: 0.015% gel for face and scalp; 0.05% gel for trunk and extremities
  • Actinic keratosis, Face and Scalp: Apply 0.015% gel TOPICALLY to affected area once daily for 3 consecutive days; allow to dry for 15 minutes; avoid touching or washing area for 6 hours after application
  • Actinic keratosis, Trunk and Extremities: Apply 0.05% gel TOPICALLY to affected area once daily for 2 consecutive days; allow to dry for 15 minutes; avoid touching or washing area for 6 hours after application

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: Safety and effectiveness not established in patients younger than 18 years

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Actinic keratosis, Face and Scalp
  • Actinic keratosis, Trunk and Extremities

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• application to skin not healed after previous drug or surgical treatment is not recommended
  • eye disorders (eg, severe eye pain, eyelid edema, eyelid ptosis, periorbital edema) may occur after accidental exposure to eye
  • skin reactions of the treated area, severe (eg, erythema, crusting, swelling, vesiculation/postulation, and erosion/ulceration), have been reported
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Application site infection (8%), Application site irritation (4%), Application site pain (2% to 15%), Crust on skin (any grade, 74% to 80%; grade 4, 4% to 6%), Erythema (any grade, 92% to 94%; grade 4, 19% to 24%), Peeling of skin (any grade, 85% to 90%; grade 4, 8% to 9%), Pruritus, Application site (8%), Pustular vasculitis (any grade, 44% to 56%; grade 4, 1% to 5%), Superficial ulcer of skin (any grade, 26% to 32%; grade 4, up to 1%), Swelling of skin (any grade, 64% to 79%; grade 4, 3% to 5%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (2%)
  • Ophthalmic:Periorbital edema (3%)
  • Respiratory:Nasopharyngitis (2%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: The mechanism by which ingenol mebutate induces cell death in actinic keratosis lesions is not known.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • Note: 0.015% gel for face and scalp; 0.05% gel for trunk and extremities
  • Spread contents of single-dose tube evenly over affected area (contiguous area up to 25 cm(2))
  • Allow to dry for 15 minutes; do not touch or wash area for 6 hours after application

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: no specific monitoring has been determined

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to avoid contact with the periocular area. If accidental exposure occurs, flush eyes with water and seek immediate medical care.
  • This drug may cause local skin reactions (erythema, flaking/scaling, crusting, swelling, vesiculation/pustulation, and erosion/ulceration); pain, pruritus, irritation, or infection of the application site; headache; or nasopharyngitis.
  • Advise patient to wash their hands immediately after applying drug and avoid transfer of drug to other areas, or to another person.
  • Instruct patient to allow gel to dry for 15 minutes after application; avoid washing and touching the treated area, or participating in activities that cause excessive sweating, for 6 hours after treatment; may wash the area with mild soap after 6 hours.
  • Instruct patient not to apply drug on skin that is not healed from any previous drug or surgical treatment.
